alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Gusty outflow winds will impact portions of Salt Lake...Davis... west central Morgan...northwestern Utah and east central Tooele Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, mesonet observations were reporting gusty outflow winds 9 miles northwest of Magna, or 13 miles northwest of West Valley City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust may significantly reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Layton, Murray, Bountiful, Farmington, Hill Air Force Base, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Clearfield, Midvale, Kaysville, Holladay and American Fork. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on the Great Salt Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 280 and 335. Interstate 84 between mile markers 88 and 91. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 97 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
